get.description: Port profiles, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

post.summary: Create a new port profile by unique name
post.description: List of Port profile, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

get.description: List of Port profile, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

patch.description: List of Port profile, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

delete.description: List of Port profile, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaApPortProfile_ApPortProfilesSchema.description: Port profiles, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

profile.description: List of Port profile, config parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

description.description: User-defined description or comment for the Port Profile.

port-type.x-typeDescription: For microbranch AP, port type WAN means uplink, port type LAN means downlink
port-type.description: Port works in WAN or LAN.

poe.description: Config PoE on the port, PoE is a technology for wired Ethernet LANs to carry electric power required for the device in the data cables.

enabled.description: Enable or disable PoE in the ethernet interface.

stp.description: Config Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) on the port, Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) is a network protocol used to prevent loops in Ethernet networks.

loop-protect.description: Config loop protection on the port.

enable.description: Enables loop protect on the L2 interface.

re-enable.description:
If the Ethernet port of AP is marked with status Loop-ERR and shutdown, at the
expiry of the auto-recovery-interval, the Loop-ERR status of the Ethernet port
will be cleared and the port will be re-enabled automatically.

re-enable-timer.description: Time interval for enabling port blocked by loop-protect.

storm-control-broadcast.description:
During broadcast-storm control, AP counts the broadcast packets received
on each of its Ethernet port and determines the packet rate in an interval.
If the broadcast packet rate on one Ethernet port exceeds the configured
threshold (default value is 2000 packets per second), the Ethernet port
is shut down.

storm-control-threshold.description:
The threshhold is used for storm-control-broadcast, if the broadcast packet
rate on one Ethernet port exceeds the threshold (default value is 2000
packets per second), the Ethernet port will be shut down.

port-bond.description: Bond this Ethernet port into virtual port bond0 as uplink.

client-isolation.description: Disable all peer-to-peer communication in the VLAN network.

forward-mode.x-typeDescription: Forwarding mode for the network on AP
forward-mode.description: Forwarding mode for the network on AP.

inactivity-timeout.description: Specify an interval for a client session timeout in seconds.

out-of-service.description: Out of service type for this wired profile.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

description.description: User-defined description or comment for the Port Profile.

port-type.x-typeDescription: For microbranch AP, port type WAN means uplink, port type LAN means downlink
port-type.description: Port works in WAN or LAN.

poe.description: Config PoE on the port, PoE is a technology for wired Ethernet LANs to carry electric power required for the device in the data cables.

enabled.description: Enable or disable PoE in the ethernet interface.

stp.description: Config Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) on the port, Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) is a network protocol used to prevent loops in Ethernet networks.

loop-protect.description: Config loop protection on the port.

enable.description: Enables loop protect on the L2 interface.

re-enable.description:
If the Ethernet port of AP is marked with status Loop-ERR and shutdown, at the
expiry of the auto-recovery-interval, the Loop-ERR status of the Ethernet port
will be cleared and the port will be re-enabled automatically.

re-enable-timer.description: Time interval for enabling port blocked by loop-protect.

storm-control-broadcast.description:
During broadcast-storm control, AP counts the broadcast packets received
on each of its Ethernet port and determines the packet rate in an interval.
If the broadcast packet rate on one Ethernet port exceeds the configured
threshold (default value is 2000 packets per second), the Ethernet port
is shut down.

storm-control-threshold.description:
The threshhold is used for storm-control-broadcast, if the broadcast packet
rate on one Ethernet port exceeds the threshold (default value is 2000
packets per second), the Ethernet port will be shut down.

port-bond.description: Bond this Ethernet port into virtual port bond0 as uplink.

client-isolation.description: Disable all peer-to-peer communication in the VLAN network.

forward-mode.x-typeDescription: Forwarding mode for the network on AP
forward-mode.description: Forwarding mode for the network on AP.

inactivity-timeout.description: Specify an interval for a client session timeout in seconds.

out-of-service.description: Out of service type for this wired profile.

ArubaApPortProfile_PortPorfileSecurityCo.description: AP security config for port profile.

ArubaApPortProfile_WiredPortVlanConfig.description: Config VLAN parameters on an port, such like trunk or access, native VLAN ID, allowed VLANs.

switchport.description: Config VLAN parameters on an port, such like trunk or access, native VLAN ID, allowed VLANs.

interface-mode.description: Interface access or trunk mode for VLANs.

native-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
native-vlan.description:
Native VLAN id for untagged frames arriving on
a trunk interface.  Tagged frames sent on an interface
configured with a native VLAN should have their tags
stripped prior to transmission. This configuration is only
valid on a trunk interface.

access-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
access-vlan.description: Assign the access VLAN to the access port.

x-enumDescriptions.NAMED_VLAN: Configure the VLAN(s) using a named-VLAN
x-enumDescriptions.VLAN_RANGES: Configure the VLAN(s) as a list of VLAN ranges

allowed-vlan-selector.description:
Method to specify the VLAN(s) for this port:
If it is 'VLAN_RANGES', it can be a combination of
list of VLAN-ID-ranges and list of VLAN-IDs
Example: 61-65,67,69,71-75.

allowed-vlan-name.description: Named-VLAN to map to this port.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: List of VLANs or VLAN ranges to map to this port.

trunk-vlan-all.description: Allow all vlans for trunk mode interface.

dot1x-timer-idrequest-period.description: Time period (in seconds) to wait for a response from a client before retransmitting an EAPoL PDU.

l2-auth-failthrough.description: Continue with 802.1x authentication even if MAC auth fail.

ArubaWlanSecurity_SecurityCommonConfig.description: Wireless and wired common parameters for security.

radius-reauth-interval.description: Radius reauth interval, when session timeout, device do reauth.

use-ip-for-calling-station-id.description: Use IP as Calling Station Id.

radius-loc-obj-in-access.description: Enable location in radius access request.

radius-loc-obj-in-accting.description: Enable location in radius accounting request.

download-role.description: A user is assigned a role by ClearPass Policy Manager. If the role is not defined on the Instant AP, the role attributes can also be downloaded automatically.

ArubaWlanSecurity_AuthServerConfig.description: Group for Radius accounting related configurations.

primary-auth-server.description: Primary server for authentication under SSID profile or wired port profile.

backup-auth-server.description: Backup server for authentication under SSID profile or wired port profile.

auth-server-group.description: Server group to be used for authentication under the SSID profile or wired port profile.

ArubaWlanSecurity_RadiusAccountingConfig.description: Group for Radius accounting related configurations.

primary-acct-server.description: Primary accounting servers for radius accounting under the SSID profile or wired port profile.

backup-acct-server.description: Backup accounting servers for radius accounting under the SSID profile or wired port profile.

acct-server-group.description:
Server group to be used for accounting under the SSID profile or wired port profile. The primary/backup accounting
server and accounting server group only support one configuration at a time. If both are configured simultaneously,
the accounting server group will be used during accounting.

x-enumDescriptions.USER_ASSOCIATION: When configured, the accounting starts when the client associates to the network successfully and stops when the client is disconnected.
x-enumDescriptions.USER_AUTHENTICATION: when configured, the accounting starts only after client authentication is successful and stops when the client logs out of the network.

cp-accounting-mode.x-typeDescription: Configure an accounting mode for the captive portal users.
cp-accounting-mode.description: Radius Accounting Mode just for captive portal.

pre-auth-role.description: Configure a pre-authentication role to allow some access to the guest users before the client authentication.

mac-auth-only-role.description:
Allow administrator to create a MAC Authentication only role for role-based access rule when MAC authentication is enabled for Captive Portal.
If MAC authentication is successful, the mac-auth-only role will be assigned to the client.

machine-auth.description:
Configure a machine authentication rule. When a Windows device boots, it logs onto the network domain using a machine account. Within the domain, the device is authenticated
before computer group policies and software settings can be executed; this process is known as machine authentication. Machine authentication ensures that only authorized devices
are allowed on the network. You can configure 802.1X for both user and machine authentication. This tightens the authentication process further, since both the device and user need
to be authenticated. This feature is applicable for 802.1x authenticaion and it is only applicable for AP.

machine-only-role.description: Client can obtain machine auth role, when it only pass machine authentication. Assign different rights to clients based on whether their hardware device supports machine authentication.

user-only-role.description: Client can obtain user only role, when using username and password pass authentication.

default-role.description: When Default role is configured, default role is used. If default role isn't configured, use the role that the role name is same as SSID profile name.

x-enumDescriptions.CENTRAL_NAC: Using Central Network Access Control(NAC) as the Captive Portal Server.

captive-portal-type.description: For Captive Portal Server, AP supports Central Network Access Control(NAC) and External Captive Portal.

captive-portal.description: Associate one Captive Portal profile under SSID profile or wired port profile.

items.description: For Captive Portal Server, customer can disable redirection to the captive portal based on the type of current uplink.

called-station-id.description:
Configure this parameter to be sent with the RADIUS attribute Called Station ID for authentication and accounting requests. For AP, this API is applicable for
WLAN profile and AP port profile. For GW, this API is applicable for the authentication server profile. This feature is applicable for AP and GW.

type.description:
Configure the called-station-id types.
For AP, The type includes AP group, AP MAC address, AP name, AP IP or user vlan. The default value is AP MAC address.

mac-address-delimiter.description: By default, called-station-id is AP MAC Address string and no delimiter, when configure mac-address-delimiter, AP MAC Address will be added delimiter in authentication packet.

upper-case.description: By default, called-station-id is AP MAC Address string, when enabled upper-case, AP MAC Address will be changed to upper case in authentication packet.

include-ssid-delimiter.description: The delimiter between mac address and SSID. For example, the delimiter is dash. The called-station-id like aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff-wlanssid.

assignment-rules.description:
Assign the client a user role, VLAN ID or VLAN name based on attributes. For GW and AP, the attributes is returned for the client by the authentication server and this API is applicable for
auth server group. For AP, this API is also applicable WLAN profile and if this API works in WLAN profile, the attributes can be returned for the client by the authentication server or other
attributes such as mac-address, dhcp-option, AP-Name, etc. Rules are ordered: the first rule that matches the configured condition is applied. VLAN IDs and VLAN names cannot be listed together.
This feature is only applicable for AP and GW.

sequence-id.description: The sequence id determines the rule order.

attribute.description:
Attribute returned by the authentication server.
For AP, it also includes some custom attributes like mac-address, dhcp-option and fw_mode.

operand.description:
Match operand, For GW, the VSA value. For AP, it is VSA value under server group profile.
It is VSA value and mac-addrees, dhcp-option and fw_mode under SSID profile and AP wired port profile.

vlan.description: This is the assigned VLAN when there is a rule match.

role.description: This is the assigned Role when there is a rule match.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
